intro: Hyphaene occidentalis, commonly known as the African date palm, is a tall, slender palm native to the dry regions of Africa. It has a tall, unbranched trunk with a smooth, fibrous outer layer. Its leaves are large, pinnate, and arranged in a crown at the top of the trunk. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, fibrous fruits. It is well adapted to arid environments and has cultural and economic significance in many African communities.
